alert.note: Alert for Norman; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 5:09PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Norman, southwestern Polk, southeastern Grand Forks and northeastern Traill Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Climax, or 25 miles southeast of Grand Forks. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crookston, Thompson, Fisher, Buxton, Reynolds, Climax and Shelly. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 106 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
